Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Access Settings - Open VSCode Settings (GUI or JSON)
Prerequisites: VSCode with Snyk extension installed, Authenticated Snyk account with multiple organizations, A test workspace folder open in VSCode, Language Server initialized and folder configs received

Step Description: Navigate to Extensions → Snyk section (or search for ""snyk"")

Step Description: Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox is present

Step Description: Test Organization Field Visibility - Verify field is visible

Step Description: Verify field is always editable (VSCode doesn't disable it)

Step Description: Test Manual Organization Setting - Uncheck ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox

Step Description: Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field remains editable (always editable in VSCode)

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Enter a valid organization ID in the ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Verify settings are saved automatically in VSCode (no Apply button needed)

Step Description: Verify the setting is saved in settings.json with correct format

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Verify text field shows correct organization value

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Verify Language Server Communication - Open VSCode Output panel (View → Output)

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Select ""Snyk"" from the output channel dropdown

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Monitor for registerNotifier - sending folderConfig to client folderConfig instead of WorkspaceDidChangeConfiguration

Test Case Name: Organization Selection in Workspace Folder Settings
Step Description: Verify folder config is sent to Language Server with correct preferredOrg and orgSetByUser values
Test Checkbox Visibility and Initial State - Open VSCode Settings
Prerequisites: Same as Test Case 1, Language Server has received folder configs with autoDeterminedOrg populated

Step Description: Navigate to Extensions → Snyk section
Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox is present
Verify checkbox description explains auto-select behavior
Verify checkbox initial state matches orgSetByUser value from Language Server (Checked if orgSetByUser = false

Test Checkbox Behavior - Enabling Auto-Select - If checkbox is unchecked check ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" (Note: This applies to the checkbox in workspace settings (folder-level or workspace-level). The checkbox in global settings does not update org.)
Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field shows autoDeterminedOrg value (if available)
Verify field remains editable (VSCode doesn't make it read-only)
Verify settings.json shows autoSelectOrganization: true
Test Checkbox Behavior - Disabling Auto-Select - Uncheck ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox
Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field remains editable
Verify field may be empty or show previous value
Verify user can enter manual organization value
Verify settings.json behavior (Note: settings.json never sets the value to false. Instead
Notes/Comments: the key is removed completely from settings.json. It does set orgSetByUser: false in the folder config sent to the Language Server. If organization is set
Tester: verify settings.json shows organization value only.)

Step Description: Test Auto-Select Functionality - Ensure checkbox is checked (auto-select enabled)
Verify settings are saved automatically
Run a Snyk scan (manually or wait for auto-scan)
Verify scan uses autoDeterminedOrg from Language Server
Verify scan results are associated with the correct organization
Test Manual Override - Uncheck ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization""
Enter a specific organization ID in ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field (Note: SLUG IS CASE SENSITIVE - ensure the organization slug is entered with the correct casing)
Verify settings are saved automatically
Run a Snyk scan
Verify scan uses the manually entered organization
Verify orgSetByUser = true in folder config sent to Language Server
Test Auto-Select with Single Folder Workspace - Open a workspace with a single folder
Navigate to Settings → Extensions → Snyk
Change ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox state
Verify settings are saved to the folder's .vscode/settings.json
Verify settings are NOT written to workspace-level settings.json (since single folder = folder level)
Verify Language Server receives folder config with correct orgSetByUser value
Verify scans use the correct organization based on folder config
Test Auto-Select with Multiple Folder Workspace - Open a workspace with multiple folders (File → Add Folder to Workspace)
Configure different auto-select settings for each folder (Folder A: enabled Folder B: disabled)
Verify each folder's .vscode/settings.json contains its own settings
Verify workspace-level .vscode/settings.json (if exists) does NOT contain folder-specific org settings
Verify each folder maintains independent organization settings
Run scans on each folder and verify each uses the correct organization
Test Auto-Select Change at Workspace Level - Open a workspace with multiple folders
Open workspace-level settings (workspace root .vscode/settings.json)
Set ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" at workspace level
Verify workspace-level setting is saved in workspace root .vscode/settings.json
Verify folder-level settings take precedence over workspace-level
Verify if a folder has no folder-level setting it falls back to workspace-level
Verify Language Server reads settings at folder level (like other IDEs)
Change auto-select at workspace level
Verify folders without folder-level settings inherit the workspace-level change
Verify folders with folder-level settings are NOT affected by workspace-level change
Test Auto-Select Change at Global/User Level - Open User Settings (File → Preferences → Settings → User tab or user settings.json)
Set ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" at user/global level
Verify user-level setting is saved in user settings.json
Verify folder-level settings take precedence over user-level
Verify workspace-level settings take precedence over user-level
Verify if a folder has no folder/workspace-level setting it falls back to user-level
Verify Language Server reads settings at folder level (like other IDEs)
Change auto-select at user level
Verify folders without folder/workspace-level settings inherit the user-level change
Verify folders with folder/workspace-level settings are NOT affected by user-level change
Test Settings.json Writing Behavior (Critical) - Test Single Folder Workspace Folder-Level Setting
Open single folder workspace
Set organization at folder level
Verify .vscode/settings.json in the folder contains the setting
Verify workspace-level .vscode/settings.json does NOT exist (single folder = no workspace file needed)
Test Multiple Folder Workspace - Folder-Level Setting
Open workspace with multiple folders
Set organization for Folder A at folder level
Verify Folder A's .vscode/settings.json contains the setting
Verify workspace root .vscode/settings.json does NOT contain folder-specific org settings
Verify Folder B's .vscode/settings.json does NOT contain org settings (if not set for Folder B)
Test Multiple Folder Workspace - Workspace-Level Setting
Open workspace with multiple folders
Set organization at workspace level (workspace root .vscode/settings.json)
Verify workspace root .vscode/settings.json contains the setting
Verify individual folder .vscode/settings.json files do NOT contain org settings (unless explicitly set at folder level)
Verify folders without folder-level settings use workspace-level setting
Test User-Level Setting
Set organization at user level (user settings.json)
Verify user settings.json contains the setting
Verify NO .vscode/settings.json files are created/modified (user-level doesn't require workspace files)
Verify folders without folder/workspace-level settings use user-level setting
Test Auto-Select Default Value (true)
Open workspace folder
Verify if auto-select is at default value (true) and matches Language Server's orgSetByUser = false
Verify Settings.json should NOT be written if value matches default
Change auto-select to false then back to true
Verify settings.json behavior (may or may not remove the setting depending on VSCode behavior)
Test Organization Field Empty
Set auto-select to false (manual mode)
Leave organization field empty
Verify if organization is empty and matches default/fallback settings.json may not need to contain it
Verify settings.json should only contain organization field if it has a meaningful value
Verify Language Server should use fallback hierarchy when organization is empty
Test Settings UI Loading - Open VSCode Settings (GUI or JSON)
Prerequisites: VSCode with Snyk extension, Test workspace folder open, Language Server initialized

Step Description: Navigate to Extensions → Snyk section
Verify all Snyk settings load correctly (Auto-select organization Organization Other Snyk settings)
Verify no errors in Output panel
Test Field Population on Settings Open - With auto-select enabled (orgSetByUser = false)
Verify checkbox is checked

Verify field remains editable
With auto-select disabled (orgSetByUser = true)
Verify checkbox is unchecked
Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" shows preferredOrg value (or empty if not set)
Verify field is editable
With no folder config (Language Server not initialized)
Verify settings show default values
Verify fields are editable
Test Field Validation - Enter invalid organization ID format in ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization""
Test with empty fields
Test with very long organization strings
Verify VSCode settings validation (if any)
Verify Language Server handles invalid values gracefully
Test Settings Persistence - Make changes to organization settings (Toggle auto-select checkbox Enter organization value)
Verify settings are saved automatically in VSCode
Verify changes are saved in settings.json
Verify Language Server receives update via ConfigurationWatcher
Close and reopen Settings
Verify changes are persisted
Test Configuration Levels - Test setting organization at different levels (Folder level Workspace level User level)
Verify folder-level setting takes precedence
Verify fallback to workspace/user level works correctly
Verify Language Server receives correct organization based on hierarchy
Test Settings.json Direct Editing - Open settings.json directly (JSON view)
Manually edit organization settings (autoSelectOrganization and organization fields)
Save the file
Verify ConfigurationWatcher detects the change
Verify folder config is updated
Verify Language Server receives update
Test Configuration Propagation - Open VSCode Settings
Prerequisites: VSCode with Snyk extension, Language Server running and initialized, Multiple workspace folders (optional for multi-folder testing)

Step Description: Change organization settings (Toggle auto-select checkbox Enter/change organization value)
Verify settings are saved automatically
Monitor Language Server communication (Check Output panel for WorkspaceDidChangeConfiguration calls)
Verify folder config contains updated values (preferredOrg matches organization field value orgSetByUser matches checkbox state autoDeterminedOrg is preserved)
Test FolderConfig Update Logic - With auto-select enabled (checkbox checked)
Verify folder config sent to LS has orgSetByUser = false preferredOrg = "" (empty string) autoDeterminedOrg unchanged (from LS)
With auto-select disabled (checkbox unchecked)
Enter organization in ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field
Verify folder config sent to LS has orgSetByUser = true preferredOrg = value from organization field autoDeterminedOrg unchanged (from LS)

Configure different organizations for different folders (Folder A: Auto-select enabled Folder B: Manual organization ""org-123"" Folder C: Manual organization ""org-456"")
Verify each folder maintains its own organization setting
Verify each folder's settings.json has correct values
Run scans on each folder
Verify each folder uses the correct organization
Test Language Server Response - Make organization setting changes
Verify settings are saved automatically
Wait for Language Server to process configuration
Verify Language Server sends updated folder configs back via $/snyk.folderConfig notification
Verify extension updates VSCode config to reflect any changes from Language Server
Verify autoDeterminedOrg is updated by Language Server (if LDX-Sync provides new value)
Test Fallback Behavior - Clear organization field (set to empty)
Disable auto-select
Verify VSCode configuration hierarchy is used as fallback (Folder-level setting Workspace-level setting User-level setting Default empty string)
Verify Language Server receives organization from LanguageServerSettings
Run scan and verify correct organization is used
Test Configuration Watcher Sync - Change organization setting in VSCode UI
Verify ConfigurationWatcher detects the change
Verify syncFolderConfigAutoOrgOnChange or syncFolderConfigPreferredOrgOnWorkspaceFolderOrgSettingChanged is called
Verify folder config is updated
Verify Language Server receives update
Verify no circular updates (check foldersBeingUpdatedByLS flag)

Step Description: Verify settings UI handles gracefully
Verify fallback to configuration hierarchy works
Verify no crashes or errors

Verify fallback behavior
Verify Language Server receives correct values

Open Settings (user-level)

Verify no errors when accessing settings without workspace folder

Make rapid changes in settings.json
Verify no race conditions or UI glitches
Verify final state is correct
Verify ConfigurationWatcher handles rapid changes correctly
Test Special Characters - Enter organization with special characters (if valid)
Enter very long organization strings
Enter organization with unicode characters

Verify Language Server receives correct values

In another editor modify settings.json directly
Verify extension handles concurrent modifications correctly
Verify Language Server receives consistent state
Verify ConfigurationWatcher detects changes correctly

Verify Language Server handles initialization correctly
Verify folder configs are created properly
Verify organization is properly used
Test Circular Update Prevention - Change organization setting
Verify foldersBeingUpdatedByLS flag prevents circular updates
Verify Language Server updates don't trigger watcher updates
Verify no infinite loops

Test Receiving Migrated Folder Config from LS - Open a workspace folder that has an organization setting but no folder config
Prerequisites: VSCode with Snyk extension, Test workspace folder with existing organization setting, Language Server initialized, Access to Language Server config directory (for resetting migration state), jq and sponge tools installed (for resetting migration state)

Step Description: Verify Language Server initializes
Verify extension receives folder config from LS via $/snyk.folderConfig notification

Verify migrated folder config is handled correctly (orgMigratedFromGlobalConfig flag received preferredOrg or autoDeterminedOrg populated orgSetByUser set correctly VSCode settings UI reflects migrated state)
Test Display of Migrated Organization Settings - With migrated folder config received from LS
Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox state matches !orgSetByUser
Verify ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field shows correct value (If orgSetByUser = false: Shows autoDeterminedOrg If orgSetByUser = true: Shows preferredOrg)
Verify settings are saved correctly in VSCode config
Test Migration State Reset (for re-testing) - Locate Language Server config directory (~/.config/snyk/ or similar)
Look for config file: ls-config-Visual Studio Code or similar
To reset folder config back to unmigrated state use jq command
Restart Language Server or VSCode
Verify extension receives unmigrated folder config from LS
Verify LS migrates it and sends back migrated config
Verify extension handles the re-migrated config correctly
Test Migration with Default Organization - Set organization to user's default organization (or empty) in VSCode settings
Reset migration state (using command from 7.3)
Open workspace folder and trigger migration (handled by LS)
Verify extension receives migrated folder config with orgSetByUser = false (user opted into LDX-Sync) autoDeterminedOrg populated from LDX-Sync orgMigratedFromGlobalConfig = true
Verify VSCode settings UI reflects auto-select enabled
Test Migration with Non-Default Organization - Set organization to a non-default organization in VSCode settings
Reset migration state
Open workspace folder and trigger migration (handled by LS)
Verify extension receives migrated folder config with orgSetByUser = true (user opted out of LDX-Sync) preferredOrg set to the organization value orgMigratedFromGlobalConfig = true
Verify VSCode settings UI reflects manual organization mode
Test Migration with Existing Folder Config - Create a workspace folder with existing folder config (already migrated)
Verify extension receives folder config from LS
Verify migration does not run again (handled by LS)
Verify existing folder config values are preserved
Verify orgMigratedFromGlobalConfig remains true
Test Extension Handling of Unmigrated Folder Configs - Reset migration state (using command from 7.3)
Open workspace folder
Verify extension receives unmigrated folder config from LS (if LS sends it)
Verify extension handles it gracefully (No crashes or errors Extension waits for LS to migrate Extension receives migrated config after LS processes it)
Test Migration with Single Folder Workspace - Open a single folder workspace
Set organization at folder level (or user level) before migration
Reset migration state (using command from 7.3)
Open workspace folder and trigger migration (handled by LS)
Verify extension receives migrated folder config from LS
Verify .vscode/settings.json in the folder reflects migrated state (Auto-select checkbox state matches !orgSetByUser Organization field shows correct value)
Verify settings are written to folder-level .vscode/settings.json (not workspace-level since single folder)
Verify Language Server reads settings at folder level
Test Migration with Multiple Folder Workspace - Open a workspace with multiple folders

Set different organization settings for different folders before migration (Folder A: Organization ""org-123"" at folder level Folder B: Organization at workspace level Folder C: No organization setting will use user-level or default)
Reset migration state for all folders
Open workspace and trigger migration (handled by LS)
Verify each folder receives its own migrated folder config from LS

Verify each folder's .vscode/settings.json reflects its migrated state (Folder A: Settings in Folder A's .vscode/settings.json Folder B: Settings in workspace root .vscode/settings.json workspace-level Folder C: May use user-level settings or default)
Verify workspace root .vscode/settings.json does NOT contain folder-specific org settings for Folder A
Verify Language Server reads each folder's settings at folder level (like other IDEs)
Test Migration with Workspace-Level Organization - Open workspace with multiple folders
Set organization at workspace level (workspace root .vscode/settings.json) before migration
Reset migration state
Open workspace and trigger migration (handled by LS)
Verify workspace-level organization is migrated by LS
Verify each folder receives migrated folder config (may inherit from workspace-level)
Verify workspace root .vscode/settings.json reflects migrated state
Verify individual folder .vscode/settings.json files do NOT contain org settings (unless explicitly set at folder level)
Verify Language Server reads settings at folder level using workspace-level as fallback
Test Migration with Global/User-Level Organization - Set organization at user/global level (user settings.json) before migration
Open workspace folder(s) without folder/workspace-level org settings
Reset migration state
Trigger migration (handled by LS)
Verify user-level organization is migrated by LS
Verify folders without folder/workspace-level settings receive migrated config based on user-level
Verify user settings.json reflects migrated state
Verify NO .vscode/settings.json files are created/modified (user-level doesn't require workspace files)
Verify Language Server reads settings at folder level using user-level as fallback
Test Migration - Settings.json Writing Behavior - Test Migration with Default Values
Reset migration state
Open folder with no existing org settings
Trigger migration (LS migrates to auto-select enabled default org)
Verify if migrated state matches defaults .vscode/settings.json may not need org settings
Verify settings.json should only be written if migrated state differs from defaults
Verify Language Server uses folder config (which may have migrated values)
Test Migration with Non-Default Values
Reset migration state
Open folder with existing org setting (non-default)
Trigger migration (LS migrates to manual mode with preferred org)

Verify settings reflect migrated state (auto-select false preferred org set)
Verify settings are written because they differ from defaults

Folder A: Has org setting → migrates to manual mode
Folder B: No org setting → migrates to auto-select mode

Test VSCode Config → Folder Config Sync (Auto-Select) - Open Settings
Prerequisites: VSCode with Snyk extension, Authenticated Snyk account, Test workspace folder, Language Server initialized

Step Description: Toggle ""Snyk: Advanced: Auto Select Organization"" checkbox
Verify settings are saved automatically
Verify ConfigurationWatcher detects the change
Verify syncFolderConfigAutoOrgOnChange is called
Verify folder config is updated (orgSetByUser matches checkbox state !autoSelectOrganization)
Verify Language Server receives update via WorkspaceDidChangeConfiguration
Test VSCode Config → Folder Config Sync (Organization) - Open Settings
Change ""Snyk: Advanced: Organization"" field
Verify settings are saved automatically
Verify ConfigurationWatcher detects the change
Verify syncFolderConfigPreferredOrgOnWorkspaceFolderOrgSettingChanged is called
Verify folder config is updated (preferredOrg matches organization field value)
Verify Language Server receives update
Test Folder Config → VSCode Config Sync (from LS) - Language Server sends updated folder config via $/snyk.folderConfig notification
Verify handleOrgSettingsFromFolderConfigs is called
Verify VSCode config is updated (Organization field shows autoDeterminedOrg or preferredOrg based on orgSetByUser Auto-select checkbox matches !orgSetByUser)
Verify foldersBeingUpdatedByLS flag prevents circular updates
Test Circular Update Prevention - Change organization setting in VSCode UI
Verify foldersBeingUpdatedByLS flag is set when LS updates VSCode config
Verify watcher skips updates when flag is set (Check LanguageServer.isLSUpdatingOrg() in watcher)
Verify flag is cleared after update completes
Verify no infinite loops occur
Test Rapid Changes - Make rapid changes to organization settings
Toggle auto-select multiple times
Change organization value multiple times
Verify ConfigurationWatcher handles rapid changes correctly
Verify no race conditions
Verify final state is correct
Test Direct JSON Editing - Open settings.json directly
Manually edit organization settings
Save the file
Verify ConfigurationWatcher detects the change
Verify folder config is updated
Verify Language Server receives update
